entry.title: Mexico SMS Carrier Partner Maintenance
entry.summary: THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Nov 11, 22:00 PST - Nov 12, 03:00 PST Nov 10, 20:35 PST Scheduled - Our SMS carrier partner in Mexico is conducting an emergency maintenance on 11 November 2022 22:00 PST until 12 November 2022 03:00 PST During the maintenance window, there could be intermittent delays delivering SMS to and from Mexico handsets.

We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available. Nov 11, 09:26 PST Update - We are still experiencing SMS delivery failures over a subset of short codes to Sprint Spectrum network in the US. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available. Nov 11, 08:28 PST Investigating - We are experiencing SMS delivery failures over a subset of short codes to Sprint Spectrum network in the US. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

entry.title: RESOLVED: We're aware of a problem with Google Meet affecting a significant subset of users. We will provide an update by Oct 31, 2022, 2:00 AM UTC detailing when we expect to resolve the problem. Please note that this resolution time is an estimate and may change.
entry.summary:
Incident began at 2022-10-28 16:22 and ended at 2022-11-04 18:05 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

Mini Incident Report

We apologize for the inconvenience this service disruption/outage may have caused. We would like to provide some information about this incident below. Please note, this information is based on our best knowledge at the time of posting and is subject to change as our investigation continues. If you have experienced impact outside of what is listed below, please reach out to Google Workspace Support using the help article https://support.google.com/a/answer/1047213.

(All Times US/Pacific)

Incident Start: 28 October 2022 09:22

Incident End: 04 November 2022 11:05

Duration: 7 days, 1hour, 43 minutes

Affected Services and Features:

Google Meet - iOS App

Regions/Zones: Global

Description:

A subset of Google Meet iOS App users experienced issues with Phone Number registration. From preliminary analysis, the root cause is a latent issue at the time of registration. The latest version of Google Meet iOS App which contains the fix was released to the AppStore on 04 November 2022.

Customer Impact:

Google Meet iOS App users may have encountered an “unable to add calling” error which resulted in Phone number registration failures.

Affected products: Google Meet

entry.title: Incident: Users having trouble creating a workflow in Workflow Builder
entry.summary:
Issue Summary:
On Wednesday, November 2nd at 2:12 PM PST to 4:34 PM PST, some users were running into issues with publishing a workflow when using Workflow Builder. Clicking the “Next” button would not return any response, and would cause a workflow to remain in its unpublished state. A new code change had been deployed that caused us to exit early in workflow creation and this is now fixed.

entry.title: Incident: For an emoji sent as a standalone message, the emoji code is not displayed on hover
entry.summary:
Issue Summary:
On Wednesday, October 26th at 2:15 PM PST Friday to October 28th 9:12 PM PST, some users were unable to view emoji/code previews when hovering their cursor over messages containing emojis. Upon investigation, we discovered that an error had occurred with the jumbomoji (a message with just an emoji) previewer during the process of a backend code-change we were performing related to emoji. Once we learned this, we were able to deploy a fix which rectified this issue for all affected users.

entry.title: Incident: Some users may be experiencing issues sending messages, loading threads, and saving bookmarks
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On October 28, 2022 from about 1:06 PM PDT to 1:17 PM PDT, some customers experienced trouble loading threads, sending messages, and saving bookmarks.
This issue occurred when we deployed a web app change resulting in an increased database load. We have since rolled back the deploy, restoring functionality for all affected users.

entry.title: Requests to create room amenity photos failing (Listing Photos POST Request)
entry.summary: Oct 21, 16:03 PDT Resolved - We have identified an issue with creating room amenity photos. The issue would cause POST requests to fail with either a 404 error or a 500 error. This issue approximately started from last Friday, October 14th, 2022. The photo creations are successful in most cases but the requests fail at a later stage resulting in error responses. We have fixed this issue at 3:30pm PT today, but there can be duplicate photos created for room amenities during this time. We advise you to review room amenity photos and use the DELETE endpoint to remove duplicate photos. We are sorry for the inconvenience.

entry.title: Incident: Some users are having issues searching in Slack, seeing the "Something went wrong" message.
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On October 19, 2022, from 8:17 AM to 10:13 PM PDT, some users saw a "Something went wrong" error when attempting a search query.
This issue was caused by a recent code change that resulted in searches failing.
We reverted this change, which fixed the issue for all users after a reload of Slack.

entry.title: Incident with Actions
entry.summary: Oct 18, 16:16 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Oct 18, 16:05 UTC Update - Actions is experiencing capacity constraints with hosted ubuntu-22, leading to high wait times. Other hosted labels and self-hosted runners are not impacted. We are actively working on mitigations. Oct 18, 15:53 UTC Investigating - We are investigating reports of degraded performance for Actions.

entry.title: Incident: Some users are experiencing issues loading Slack, including the Threads view, Saved items, notifications, API hyperlinks, and group DMs/channels
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On October 13, 2022 from 3:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. PDT, a number of customers had trouble loading and receiving thread notifications. Some customers may have also had trouble with loading channels, adding users to group direct messages, API hyperlink rendering, and missing Saved items.
A mass de-provisioning event inadvertently increased load across our infrastructure, causing issues with Threads for many users.
As an immediate mitigation strategy, we temporarily deactivated the Threads view for all users.
In parallel, we ended the long running de-provisioning jobs, and significantly scaled up the systems that handle those jobs. We also made several code changes to reduce the effect a de-provisioning job of this scale would have on our infrastructure, and redistributed some of the load across other parts of the system.
The optimisation and redistribution work brought error rates down, which resolved most of the issues with channel loading, group direct messages, hyperlinks, and Saved items that users were experiencing.
At this point, we made the call not to re-enable the Threads view in order to give our recovery efforts more time to restore balance to the system.
Once the load was appropriately balanced across our infrastructure, and we were able to confirm that our up-scaling systems were prepared to handle any future spikes, we re-enabled the Threads view for all users.

entry.title: Issue with template duplication
entry.summary: Oct 13, 17:47 PDT Resolved - This incident has been resolved; users should no longer be experiencing issues with template duplication. Oct 13, 16:05 PDT Identified - Some users are continuing to experience issues with template duplication. We have identified the source of the issue and are currently implementing the fix.
